course_name: Objects in Context. An Interdisciplinary Perspective on the Ancient World

tasks.stimulus: You have just accessed the archaeological collection to study an ancient statue that caught your interest. You want to start your research effectively. What do you do first?
tiny_learn: Material culture includes objects made or used by people in the past to tell us about history.
Begin by identifying and describing the object's features and context in detail.
Don't jump straight to conclusions without examining the object's context and provenance.

options.label: A
options.text: Examine the statue physically to note its materials, craftsmanship, and any damage.

options.label: B
options.text: Research what scholarly articles and previous studies say about statues from this period.

options.label: C
options.text: Make a sketch or artistic representation of the statue to explore its visual features creatively.

options.label: D
options.text: Discuss with classmates or experts to get different interpretations of the statue’s meaning.

options.label: E
options.text: Plan a presentation pitch on why this statue matters for understanding ancient culture.

options.label: F
options.text: Organize your notes and create a structured outline of what information you need to collect.

tasks.stimulus: You need to write an academic text about a funerary urn from the ancient world. How should you start your research process?
tiny_learn: Evaluating objects as historical sources means checking their origin, use, and context.
Begin by gathering background literature and comparing the object with written records.
Avoid ignoring differences between material evidence and literary sources without investigation.

options.label: A
options.text: Search the library for academic publications that discuss funerary urns and their cultural context.

options.label: B
options.text: Describe the urn’s appearance and make assumptions about its symbolism based on intuition.

options.label: C
options.text: Write an introduction first, then look for sources to fill in the details later.

options.label: D
options.text: Start organizing your bibliography before fully understanding the urn’s historical background.
